question: As per the annual report of SIPRI, which country is the highest military spender in the world?
explanation:
According to the recent annual report of Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI), the United States continue to be the highest military spender in the world in 2019 with $732 bn.
This is the first time two Asian countries China and India occupied the top-three positions. The military expenditure of China reached $261 billion in 2019, which is a 5.1% increase from the previous year. Indiaâ€™s expenditure rose by 6.8% to reach 71.1 billion.
